VII.i.3.A.4.a
.
Primary Documentary Evidence of Age
A copy or abstract of the public record of birth is considered primary documentary evidence of a child’s age.
Important
:
A birth certificate created more than four years after the date of birth is acceptable as primary evidence
only
if it is consistent with other evidence of record.
A birth certificate issued by a hospital is acceptable only as
secondary
evidence under
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 3.A.4.b
and
c
.
